channel.title: ██@Dicing@██ - Help
channel.description: Okay, I really am getting kinda mad now. I am trying to add a command for dice. So for example user: "Jeff" right 0 types ::dice it will state a random number 1-100. I am running a 317 delta server. But, I have tired over 7 different delta codes and keep coming up with errors.. Can someone please help me?

item.title: ██@Dicing@██ - Help
item.dc:creator: @I_am_Nick I am Nick
item.description:
@I_am_Nick wrote:

Killerkody, Ill tv you and do it all 100% with no errors the first time

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @killerkody killerkody
item.description:

I already had someone on my computer to try to find out… He couldn’t even figure it out… Its a delta and we both tried and got the same errors… You keep thinking oh he just to new let him do it him self… So far i had 3 people try to get this and no one can get it… I give up on the dice.

Read full topic

item.title: ██@Dicing@██ - Help
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“I am Nick, post:16, topic:427416”]I’m guessing your wanting it to say it out load so here is the code:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("roll")) { c.startAnimation(11900); c.gfx0(2075); c.forcedChat("["+ c.playerName +"] rolled a ["+ diceamount10 +"] on the PERCENTILE DICE."); int diceamount10 = c.Misc.random(100) + 1; }
At the top of your commands file if not already there import server.util.Misc;

import server.util.Misc; [/quote]
Shouldn’t

import server.util.Misc;

be there as alot of commands use

c.Misc.random(100) + 1;

?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @I_am_Nick I am Nick

I’m guessing your wanting it to say it out load so here is the code:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("roll")) { c.startAnimation(11900); c.gfx0(2075); c.forcedChat("["+ c.playerName +"] rolled a ["+ diceamount10 +"] on the PERCENTILE DICE."); int diceamount10 = c.Misc.random(100) + 1; }
At the top of your commands file if not already there import server.util.Misc;

import server.util.Misc;

item.title: ██@Dicing@██ - Help
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

killerkody:

Well it attracts attention but no one will explain how to add this to my client. I need help to add them. Like I need to know where and how to add this. I’m a new coder… I’m not the best and when I asked for help people are getting all pi**ed off cuz i need help…

This is what blah.blah means:

For example (I am using Hyperion, mine will be completely different than yours, so don’t just copy and paste, learn):

I put:

import org.hyperion.rs2.model.Location;

I can locate Location.java (From the code: model.Location) from going to \src\org\hyperion\rs2\model.

Get it?

-Arham

Read full topic

item.title: ██@Dicing@██ - Help
item.dc:creator: @killerkody killerkody
item.description:
@killerkody wrote:

Okay, I did everything you told me to do. I placed all of the codes in the right place and still get errors.

Placed this code into the misc.java file. Didn’t really explain where I place in next to…

You stated: Add this somewhere like mine is in Misc.java:

public static int random(int range) { return (int)(Math.random() * (range + 1)); }

Then in commands add your import at the top for the class you put that snippet in so mine would be:
I don’t even know what you meant… What is blah blah?

import blah.blah.Misc; "blah.blah" is the path to the class you put it in.

Do I just add this near any commands? or what?

if (playerCommand.startsWith("dice")){ c.sendMessage("You rolled a" +Misc.random(100)+ " on the dice"); }

Read full topic

@Zosedan wrote:

[quote=“killerkody, post:3, topic:427416”]Im not sure if I did the second part right. But, I got this error when I compiled.

client.java:60: error: illegal start of expression import Misc.java; ^ client.java:60: error: not a statement import Misc.java; ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

…You put it outside of the class declaration.

item.title: ██@Dicing@██ - Help
item.dc:creator: @Jazzelhawk Jazzelhawk
item.description:
@Jazzelhawk wrote:

Add this somewhere like mine is in Misc.java:

public static int random(int range) { return (int)(Math.random() * (range + 1)); }
Then in commands add your import at the top for the class you put that snippet in so mine would be:

“blah.blah” is the path to the class you put it in.

And then add this in your commands:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("dice")){ c.sendMessage("You rolled a" +Misc.random(100)+ " on the dice"); }

Read full topic
